availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Blandville, Kentucky, attorney. Hickman County, Kentucky, native. Son of Willis White and Mary Wright White. Married to Mary E. Coil White on June 19, 1860. Father of William F. White and Willis J. White. Relocated to Blandville, Kentucky, in 1833. Educated in the common schools. Farmer from 1849 to 1851. Studied law with Judge J. M. Bigger, at Blandville, Kentucky, in 1851. Admitted to the bar in 1852 and commence law practice at Blandville. County attorney for Ballard County from 1857 to 1861.

bibl.p: J. H. Battle, W. H. Perrin, and G. C. Kniffin, Kentucky: A History of the State, Part II (Louisville: F. A. Battey Publishing Company, 1885), p. 167. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, Blandville, p. 7. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, Corporation of Blandville, p. 8.
